hackathon-description-text: At RealityHacks, you will get a chance to learn and create your imagination using tools in Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality, along with help from expereinced and dedicated mentors for 36 hours during the weekend.
hackathon-eligibility: Everyone who is registered on rhacks.com is eligible to particiapte in this Hackathon.
hackathon-rules: All the work must be created at the venue within the duration of the hackathon.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best overall hack developed using Virtual or Augmented Reality. Winners will receive an Oculus Rift CV1 each (upto 4 team members)
The team with the Best use of Microsoft Technology in their hack will receive 2 Microsoft Bands.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of Microsoft Technology - Microsoft

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the project reflect a substantial amount of accomplishment and the project demonstrates a clear concept
Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Is it just a basic use of an API, or were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Does the hack engages the user and immerse into a whole new world? Focus on User interaction and user experience is a plus

hackathon-description-header: University of Maryland's premier AR/VR Hackathon
hackathon-location-description: Computer Science Instructional Center - University of Maryland
